1.text: Wine is a mocker, and beer is a brawler. Whoever is led astray by them is not wise.

2.text: The terror of a king is like the roaring of a lion. He who provokes him to anger forfeits his own life.

3.text: It is an honor for a man to keep aloof from strife; but every fool will be quarreling.

4.text: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the winter; therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.

5.text: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.

6.text: Many men claim to be men of unfailing love, but who can find a faithful man?

7.text: A righteous man walks in integrity. Blessed are his children after him.

8.text: A king who sits on the throne of judgment scatters away all evil with his eyes.

9.text: Who can say, “I have made my heart pure. I am clean and without sin?”

10.text: Differing weights and differing measures, both of them alike are an abomination to Yahweh.

11.text: Even a child makes himself known by his doings, whether his work is pure, and whether it is right.

12.text: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, Yahweh has made even both of them.

13.text: Don’t love sleep, lest you come to poverty. Open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.

14.text: “It’s no good, it’s no good,” says the buyer; but when he is gone his way, then he boasts.

15.text: There is gold and abundance of rubies; but the lips of knowledge are a rare jewel.

16.text: Take the garment of one who puts up collateral for a stranger; and hold him in pledge for a wayward woman.

17.text: Fraudulent food is sweet to a man, but afterwards his mouth is filled with gravel.

18.text: Plans are established by advice; by wise guidance you wage war!

19.text: He who goes about as a tale-bearer reveals secrets; therefore don’t keep company with him who opens wide his lips.

20.text: Whoever curses his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in blackness of darkness.

21.text: An inheritance quickly gained at the beginning, won’t be blessed in the end.

22.text: Don’t say, “I will pay back evil.” Wait for Yahweh, and he will save you.

23.text: Yahweh detests differing weights, and dishonest scales are not pleasing.

24.text: A man’s steps are from Yahweh; how then can man understand his way?

25.text: It is a snare to a man to make a rash dedication, then later to consider his vows.

26.text: A wise king winnows out the wicked, and drives the threshing wheel over them.

27.text: The spirit of man is Yahweh’s lamp, searching all his innermost parts.

28.text: Love and faithfulness keep the king safe. His throne is sustained by love.

29.text: The glory of young men is their strength. The splendor of old men is their gray hair.

30.text: Wounding blows cleanse away evil, and beatings purge the innermost parts.
